official_title: A bill to amend title 28 of the United States Code with respect to the litigation authority of the Attorney General, to amend title 18 of the United States Code, to require the Attorney General to report on Federal case management, to require the Attorney General to provide status reports on certain cases referred to the Department of Justice, and for other purposes.
short_title: Department of Justice Litigation Improvement Act

summary.text: Department of Justice Litigation Improvement Act - Directs the Attorney General to: (1) submit a copy of any agreement with another agency which affects the litigation authority of the Department to the congressional judiciary committees 30 days before its effectiveness; (2) resolve all legal disputes between two or more agencies, absent other specific statutory authority; and (3) report to such committees at the beginning of each Congress on the status of litigation authority, coordinating efforts, and legislative proposals. Amends title V of the Ethics in Government Act (Post Employment Conflict of Interest) to extend the current criminal penalty to anyone who knowingly accepts employment with a business involving personal participation with respect to a Government grant or contract which such individual was involved with during the previous five years as a Government employee. Directs the Attorney General to: (1) submit to the congressional judiciary committees a systems development plan for the activation and coordination within the Department of compatible, comprehensive case management information and tracking systems for each judicial district; and (2) include in the authorization request a report on the status of cases referred to the Department by any Inspector General of an agency, until completion of such systems.
